definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: The buffer pool hit ratio is now showing excellent results.
sentences.chinese: 現在的緩衝池命中率就顯示了較好的結果。

sentences.english: For example, with this affinity there would be a higher cache-hit rate.
sentences.chinese: 例如，使用此關聯會產生較高的緩存命中率。

sentences.english: Rebounding was his way of atoning for his inaccuracy.
sentences.chinese: 但籃板彌補了他在命中率方面的劣勢。

sentences.english: Barry has finally got his FG and 3 PT PCT's back up to semi respectable 40% and 30% levels.
sentences.chinese: 他的命中率和三分終於回到大約三成到四成的水準。

sentences.english: Buffer pool hit ratio is very important to monitor.
sentences.chinese: 緩衝池命中率對於監控非常重要。

sentences.english: In additon, it returns the time intervals when the low hit ratio occurred.
sentences.chinese: 此外，它還返回命中率低時的時間間隔。

sentences.english: The football player was benched because of poor hitting.
sentences.chinese: 該足球運動員因射門命中率低而被換下場。

sentences.english: O-fer gets 20 and shoots a decent %, and TMac gets 8 (?).
sentences.chinese: 斯通有20分進帳而且命中率也不錯，MD得了8分？

sentences.english: But Gordon can shoot, too, with a career 38 percent mark from three-point distance.
sentences.chinese: 同時，戈登也能投籃，職業生涯38%的三分命中率。

sentences.english: Tonight was one of their better shooting nights against us.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的比賽是他們和我們對手戰中命中率較高的一晚。

sentences.english: This cache has a 99% hit rate.
Here, we are interested in the read and write cache hit rates.
sentences.chinese: 在此處，我們對讀寫緩存命中率感興趣。

sentences.english: What may make Bueno de Mesquita different is his hit rate.
sentences.chinese: 梅斯奎塔的預測命中率使他與衆不同。

sentences.english: The Rockets are 16th in scoring, 26th in field -goal percentage.
sentences.chinese: 火箭目前得分排名第16，投籃命中率第26。

sentences.english: The service scoring and block level had been improved distinctly.
sentences.chinese: 發球命中率和攔網水平有明顯的提高。

definition: to hit the target with one's throw/(basketball) to score
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
front sight (firearms)/the zero point indicator marked on a steelyard
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
the feel (of sth touched with the hand)/(textiles) handle
